title: Priyanka Chopra invests Bumble dating app ahead India launch
story: Priyanka Chopra attends the Kate Spade New York Fashion Show in September 2018 in NYCAccording to The Beehive, the Quantico actress first collaborated with the company when Bumble launched their networking mode Bumble Bizz back in October 2017.Following this, founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd recognised Chopra’s potential and together, they started to plan the rollout into India.Priyanka said: ‘Women want love, they want friendship and they want to find a career, and that’s the uniqueness of what Bumble delivers - a digital community that emcompasses all that, while empowering women to take charge of their lives.‘I’ve always believed that investing in women is key to social transformation and economic growth, and in working with Whitney and her team over the past year, I’m inspired by the real, positive change Bumble is creating and I’m proud to have the opportunity to contribute to this movement as a partner.’            Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas attend the Ralph Lauren show during New York Fashion WeekAlongside Chopra, her manager Anjula Acharia will also be joining Bumble as a strategic advisor and said: ‘There are hundreds of millions of young women in India that are part of a larger movement to take control of their lives, and they’re demanding respect and independence.‘Bumble’s values are beautifully reflective of that movement as their mission is driven to empower young women worldwide ad to give Indian woman a non-judgemental, digital neighborhood where they can feel safe and confident as they connect for work, friendship, and for love.’Earlier this year, Chopra also invested in the US coding school Holberton and joined their Board of Trustees with the aim of encouraging more women to enter the field of software engineering.At the time, the actress said: ‘No path to success is linear, but it’s staggering that women make up half the workforce and have held fewer than 25 percent of jobs in tech for the past two decades.‘At the Holberton School inclusion and ersity are more than just buzzwords, it is prioritized and infused in their DNA, and I’m looking forward to joining the Board of Trustees to help further their mission and close the gap.What is Bumble?Like most dating apps, Bumble allows people to match with those who they find physically attractive. After two people have matched, you have 24 hours to start a conversation with the other person before the connection expires. Unlike other dating apps, Bumble allows women to make the first communication after users have been matched.Bumble will launch in India before the end of 2018 and over the past year, a local team has been established in addition to a strategy and engaging key partners in the market amid increasing safety concerns over the use of dating apps.The app will roll out features that are focused on safety and adding a layer of protection to Bumble, that already include photo verification as well as photo and profile moderation. Bumble will also have versions available in both Hinglish and Hindi for iOS and Android. Who is Sat Hari Khalsa? title: Master Queens household vows 369m Buckingham Palace revamp stay budget
story: Teams have been brought in to carefully dismantle palace rooms and take the priceless goods out to storage or display          Gloved men can be seen carefully lifting chairs in one of the rooms in the palace which are frequented by the royal family          The Yellow Drawing Room in Buckingham Palace pre-reservicing. This is one of the rooms currently impacted by the works          Rooms are slowly being emptied of treasures including vases, oil lamps and artwork which date back hundreds of years           Men in gloves are tasked with carrying the rooms out to safe storage areas while the ten-year restoration works get underway          The Centre Room: Another of the palace's grand rooms which will be painstakingly taken apart and put away while the shell of the building is refurbished in a decade-long project  Among the 3,000 treasures carefully being taken away from the palace are bottle vases mounted as eight light candlebra (left) and ornate golden oil lamps with stands (right)          The grand palace was originally built as a town house for the Duke of Buckingham in 1703 but later became a royal residence      Specialist electricians are working on replacing some of the oldest (VIR) electrical cables in Buckingham Palace          The Queen is said to be taking the huge refurbishment works to her home in her stride- despite knowing she will be forced to move from the North Wing aged 99NHS surgeon who performed life-changing surgery to...The Queen's first openly gay footman, 21, who rode with her...Queen's 'woman of the bedchamber' lady-in-waiting, 81, falls...BBC boss Rosie Millard had a brain tumour the size of an...Share this articleTony Johnstone-Burt said he took the responsibility of handling public money 'extremely seriously' and was 'absolutely convinced' that the 10-year phased works would reap both short and long-term benefits.  Mr Johnstone-Burt said: 'We all take the responsibility that comes with using public funds to do all this work on such a national icon like Buckingham Palace extremely seriously indeed. on time, within budget and to the required specification.'I am absolutely convinced that by making this investment in the palace now, will not only avert much more costly and potentially catastrophic failure of the building in the years to come, but in the short term... will provide the opp for even more people to see this remarkable collection.'If at the end of the ten year programme, they are under budget, the Treasury would be entitled to take the remaining funds back, he said. Next week, a compound for builders will be erected on the forecourt of the palace as work starts on the famous east wing, the public facade which houses the balcony on which Queen Elizabeth and her family appear for significant events.          The kylin clock, made in the first half of the eighteenth century is being removed from the east wing of Buckingham Palace. The magnificent clock was known to be in the Saloon at the Royal Pavilion, Brighton in 1829          A hexagonal nine-tiered large Chinese porcelain pagoda, one of the 3,000 items in the Royal Collection being moved from the East Wing of Buckingham Palace. In eighteenth-century European art and architecture the pagoda was perhaps the most universal symbol of the OrientThe palace will remain fully open for state visits and other regular events during the overhaul and its outward appearance will be unaffected as there will be no scaffolding.Buckingham Palace was originally a large house built in 1703 and was acquired by King George III in 1761. It was extended in the reign of Queen Victoria while the front was refaced in 1914 when George V was king.   Renovation work hopes to bring the palace up to scratch and ensure that it is fit for purpose for the next 50 years. Previously the Master of The Queen's Household Tony Johnstone-Burt said: 'We take the responsibility that comes with receiving these public funds extremely seriously indeed.'Equally, we are convinced that, by making this investment in Buckingham Palace now, we can avert a much more costly and potentially catastrophic building failure in the years to come.'During the project the public will get the chance to see some more of the palace as 150 items go on display in Brighton at the Royal Pavilion, where The Duke and Duchess of Sussex visited earlier this week.           Family portraits are being taken from the Palace for various displays, including one at Brighton's Pavillion. A Johan Joseph Zoffany painting of Charlotte, Princess Royal and Prince William later Duke of Clarence (1770) is among those being taken out          Royal history is being put on display in Brighton with artwork pulled from the Buckingham Palace collection. Paintings being removed while revamp works take place include a Johan Joseph Zoffany painting of George IV when Prince of Wales, with Frederick, Duke of York when Prince Frederick (1770)          Another stunning family piece is the William Fowler III portrait of Queen Victoria as a Girl (1824-6), which is to go on loan to Kensington Palace          The Chinese Dining Room in Buckingham Palace is one of the rooms which is now being emptied out for works to take place          Electric cables are being carefully taken out and replaced over fire fears in the London palace          The cables are being carefully extracted and replaced throughout the Palace - a project which will take around ten years in total           Pipes and cables in the 315-year-old palace will need to be replaced during the major works to bring the house up to date  More than 3,000 items in the Royal Collection are being moved from the East Wing of Buckingham Palace as part of a £369 million refurbishment          More than 3,000 metres of dangerous vulcanised rubber cabling must be replaced throughout the palace           The Principal Corridor in Buckingham Palace must also be carefully dismantled and moved so works can be done on the cabling          Renovations began in April 2017 and will continue until 2027 after experts warned there was a serious fire risk to Buckingham Palace (pictured)          Nelson Mandela is just one of the thousands of dignitaries and famous faces to have visited London's Buckingham Palace to meet the Queen It is estimated that the benefits of the upgrade, including longer summer opening hours, more private tours and savings due to the improvements, could be around £3.4 million each year.The Queen spends around a third of the year hosting garden parties, receptions, investitures and other events at her official home.She hosts more than 38,000 guests per year at garden parties, and hands out 15,000 awards in ceremonies held at the palace which was acquired by King George III in 1761.It is hoped that renovations works will also be able to make the palace more environmentally friendly by replacing boilers and reducing its carbon footprint by as much as 10 per cent.          Prince Philip, 97, will be 104 when proposed works to the North wing of Buckingham Palace begin between 2025 and 2027The Prince of Wales is said to be 'fully engaged' with the project while the Duke of Edinburgh is also keeping a close eye on developments, having formerly been involved in the reservicing of Windsor Castle in 1992.The senior royal official said palace life would remain 'business as usual', with the historic ceremonies such as the Changing of the Guard continuing.Two lifts are to be installed to improve access to visitors with mobility problems.Workers will tackle three of the wings in clockwise, starting with the East, which has 200 rooms spread over six floors.Some 3,000 Royal Collection items, including 200+ paintings, 40 chandeliers, 1,000 glass and china pieces and 100 mirrors, will be removed before wiring and pipes are replaced.Some 150 items of decorative arts and furniture will return on loan to the Brighton Pavillion, where they were acquired by George IV in the early 1800s.The West wing, where ceremonial duties, state visits and investitures are held, will be tackled 'incrementally' to try and keep it fully operational.

title: Who Susan Collins Senator vote decide Brett Kavanaughs fate revealed
story: U.S. Senator Susan Collins could make or break Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nominationWho is Susan Collins?Susan Collins is a Republican U.S. Senator from Maine who’s emerged as a key swing vote in the confirmation of controversial U.S. Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh to the highest court in the United States.She was born on December 7, 1952 in Caribou, Maine.Collins attended St. Lawrence University in Canton, New York and graduated with a degree in government studies in 1975. In 1987, she served as Commissioner of the Department of Professional and Financial Regulation for the state of Maine and later as the New England regional director of the Small Business Administration in 1992.After relocating to Massachusetts to serve as the state’s Deputy State Treasurer in 1993, she returned to her native Maine in 1994 to launch a gubernatorial bid for the state’s governorship, becoming the first woman to be nominated by a major political party for the position of Governor of Maine.However, she ultimately lost the election to Angus King, who would later serve alongside her in the United States Senate.After working in the private sector, Collins again launched another political bid and was elected to the U.S. Senate in 1996, formally taking her position as Senator the following year.          Brett Kavanaugh, above, faces an extremely close confirmation battle ahead in the U.S. SenateA moderate Republican, she was reelected in 2002, 2008 and 2014. In the Senate, Collins has played a key role on many issues and chaired the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee from 2003 to 2007.In the 2016 election, she stated that should would not support the nomination of Donald Trump as the Republican standard bearer and has had a mixed record on supporting Trump after his surprise election victory, voting in favor of his proposed tax cuts in December 2017 but also opposing the President’s controversial temporary ban on travel and immigration from seven predominantly Muslim countries and his family separation policy at the U.S.-Mexico border.Collins has also emerged as a key swing vote on the nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to the U.S. Supreme Court, being set to unveil her final decision on October 5 ahead of the final vote in the U.S. Senate.How old is Susan Collins?Susan Collins is 65 years old.She was born on December 7, 1952.          Collins has served in the Senate since 1997 and considered a leading moderate voice thereWho is Susan Collins’s husband?Susan Collins’s husband is Thomas Daffron.The couple has been married since 2012.What is Susan Collins’s net worth?According to Open Secrets, Collins’s net worth is believed to be about $3.7 million (£2.8m).She is believed to draw her wealth from both her years of government service and through various financial investments.Susan Collins vote on KavanaughIn the lead-up to the final vote on the controversial nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to the U.S. Supreme Court, the Republican Senator has emerged as a critical swing vote who could ultimately decide the balance of the highest court in the United States for decades to come.Collins, who has not yet publicly decided whether she’ll vote to confirm Kavanaugh or not, has revealed that she’ll announce her decision at 3pm EST on Friday, October 5.          Senator Susan Collins will soon reveal how she intends to vote 3pm EST on Friday, October 5During a procedural vote on the morning of October 5, Collins joined other swing vote Senators like Jeff Flake and Democrat Joe Manchin in advancing Kavanaugh’s nomination to a final floor vote on October 6. Lisa Murkowski, an Alaska Republican known for bucking her party, voted against advancing Kavanaugh’s nomination.Despite voting in favor of the procedural vote to advance Kavanaugh, Collins is still undecided – at least publicly – as to whether she’ll ultimately vote to confirm him, creating much uncertainty as to whether the Supreme Court nominee has enough votes to ultimately be confirmed as the next U.S. Supreme Court Justice.The Republicans’ narrow Senate majority means that they can only afford to lose one vote if all Democrats vote against Kavanaugh and Vice President Mike Pence casts the tiebreaking vote in Kavanaugh’s favor.In addition to Collins, Senators Flake, Murkowski and Manchin have not yet publicly announced how they will vote on the planned final floor vote on Saturday, October 6.Who is Sat Hari Khalsa? title: Topshop tycoon Sir Philip Green accused tearing feminist book display
story: Topshop tycoon Sir Philip Green was embroiled in an extraordinary row last night after a display promoting a feminist book was allegedly torn down in his flagship women’s clothing storeTopshop tycoon Sir Philip Green was embroiled in an extraordinary row last night after a display promoting a feminist book was allegedly torn down in his flagship women’s clothing store.The pop-up promotion for Feminists Don’t Wear Pink And Other Lies had been set up in the Oxford Street shop, only to be dismantled 20 minutes later.The book, a collection of feminist essays, was compiled by Scarlett Curtis, daughter of comedy writer Richard Curtis and broadcaster Emma Freud.Proceeds will go to the United Nations initiative Girl Up, which provides leadership development training for young women around the world. Its publisher, Penguin, announced the cancellation of the Topshop display on Twitter – revealing the promotion had been taken down soon after being assembled.That prompted award-winning actress Thandie Newton to suggest Green was responsible for the move, labelling him a ‘loser’. The 45-year-old Line Of Duty star tweeted: ‘Yesterday Philip Green used his big muscles to smash up the Topshop penguinrandom FeministsDontWearPink pop-up because he thought it was too controversial!!? LOSER.’Miss Freud, a regular on Radio 4’s Loose Ends, tweeted: ‘This is such a bizarre shocker: yesterday Topshop tore down @scarcurtis’s pop up shop for #feministsdontwearpink on the day the book came out. On the boss’s orders. No explanation given. Maybe he just doesn’t like pink.’Last night, it was claimed that the stall was removed shortly after Green viewed it on a morning walk through the store before it opened, prompting a Penguin press officer to burst into tears.Florida student, 22, shares photos of her horror injuries...Fracking could resume in days as Government lends support...Share this articleA source told the Mail: ‘They were setting up, it was all going well, but then there was a bit of a commotion, Philip Green was stomping round…. The women from Penguin were told to go for a walk for 20 minutes, when they got back inside it had all been torn down.’Photographs shared on Twitter before it was removed show a backdrop emblazoned with slogans including ‘Feminists don’t like fashion’ and ‘feminists don’t wear make-up’ with the word ‘don’t’ crossed out in each case.Neither Topshop nor Penguin responded to questions about exactly what happened or who ordered the display to be removed. But Miss Curtis said: ‘It was a heartbreaking and shocking act. The fact they clothe an entire nation of teenage girls but won’t support something that fights for their equality is awful.’          Penguin Books UK has accused Topshop of dismantling this display at its flagship Oxford Circus store promoting Scarlett Curtis' new book Feminists Don't Wear Pink (And Other Lies), a collection of essays on feminism from 52 women amid claims its was deemed 'controversial'          Scarlett Curtis, daughter of screenwriter Richard and Emma Freud, told MailOnline she was 'heartbroken and a little shaken' by Topshop's decision to remove the pop-up display

title: Donald Tusk claims Brexit deal finalised 2019
story: European Council President Donald Tusk, pictured, has indicated he believes a deal on Britain's exit from the European Union could be completed before the end of the year          PM Theresa May will be given an opportunity to address EU leaders in Brussels during a crunch summit in Brussels on October 17-18This follows encouraging words from Commission President Jean-Claude Junker, who also indicated a deal was possible.With less than two weeks to go before a crunch summit in Brussels billed by the EU as the 'moment of truth' for Brexit negotiations, Juncker gave an upbeat assessment of the chances of a deal.Detectives probing death of gangster John 'Goldfinger'...PM launches Labour charm offensive to secure support for her...Share this articleThe change in tone comes two days after EU Council President Donald Tusk gave London a stern warning that time was running out to strike a deal in time for Britain's departure from the bloc at the end of March.Deadlines in EU talks are notoriously elastic, and Juncker told Austrian media that if an agreement was not reached at the October 17 and 18 summit, he was confident it could be done in November.  If Mrs May secures a deal in Brussels she will have to sell it to her party, some of whom are vehemently opposed to any proposal which will see Britain remain in the customs union'I have reason to believe that the potential for rapprochement between the two sides has increased in recent days,' Juncker said in comments reported by the Standard newspaper.'But it is not possible to predict whether we will be able to conclude the talks in October. If not, we will do so in November.'May has been invited to address the other 27 EU leaders over dinner on October 17, to give her a chance to convince her peers that a solution can be found to the sticking points in Britain's tortuous negotiations to leave the bloc.Diplomats have suggested the leaders could talk through the night and approve the outlines of an agreement while they are still in Brussels for the broader October 18 talks.At their annual conference this week, May urged her Conservative party - which is bitterly ided between Brexit hardliners and moderates - to unite behind her negotiating stance during what she warned would be the 'toughest phase' of talks.Juncker said the EU was determined to reach an agreement to avoid a 'no deal' Brexit, which experts say would cause chaos for both sides.'I believe that we must distance ourselves from this no deal scenario.'We are not there yet. But our will to reach an understanding with the British government remains unbroken.'           Donald Tusk, right, has held meetings with Taoiseach Leo Varadkar, left, about the future of the Irish border, which is currently the main stumbling block to securing a Brexit deal

title: Alexandra Shulmans Notebook call man live with
story: When we first got together 13 years ago, I referred to David as my boyfriend. I have continued to do so, but since he has just turned 70, even I can see that it sounds faintly delusionalThe ability for heterosexual couples to enter civil partnerships, allowing us the same tax and next-of-kin status as married couples, is an important initiative in an age when there are 3.3 million unmarried but co-habiting households in the UK.Even so I don't think we will be taking up the offer. Although we live together, we both already have children by other people, have our own properties and keep entirely separate finances. It may seem unromantic but in our case there doesn't seem much point in entering any kind of legal or religious agreement, which will only make us feel trapped when we are having one of those 'So, shall we end it now?' arguments.The knowledge that either party can walk away from our joint existence if we wish has definitely served as an adhesive rather than demonstrating a lack of commitment. But please don't call us partners.Meghan learns fastThe Duchess of Sussex is mastering the art of Royal diplomacy at an amazingly fast clip. On her and Prince Harry's first visit to Brighton last week, she was presented with what was described as an 'intersectional feminist' picture of her beagle Guy, captioned: 'A boy who makes every effort to dismantle the patriarchy.' 'How lovely,' she responded. 'Look at the little freckles on his face.'Welcome arrivalFor the first time in decades, a new drug to help with debilitating morning sickness – Xonvea – will be available on the NHS. The legacy of thalidomide, the last mainstream drug for the nausea suffered by millions of women in pregnancy, was not only the deformed limbs of 10,000 babies but an unwillingness to licence and provide any other medication for fear of any similarly apocalyptic side effects.When I was editor of Vogue, I worked with an 80 per cent female staff and saw countless of their babies grow into young men and women. I also witnessed how difficult it was for these prospective mothers to deal with the horror of the inappropriately titled morning sickness. They were often overcome throughout the day with nausea and vomiting.          The Duchess of Sussex is mastering the art of Royal diplomacy at an amazingly fast clip. On her and Prince Harry's first visit to Brighton last week, she was presented with what was described as an 'intersectional feminist' Cruelly, it was in the first early weeks, the time when pregnancies are at their most vulnerable, that they often had the worst symptoms but it was also when they wanted to keep their condition private.Few women wish to tempt fate for the first ten weeks by announcing their news to their boss and a whole office. Some were uncertain how they felt about their pregnancy, others had suffered previous miscarriages, and others were worried about how they would manage a baby and a working life.Relentless nausea while carrying on the appearance of business as usual (especially from the cramped bench seating of a month of fashion shows) is no easy task.Let's hope Xonvea will be a life-changing aid for all prospective mothers, helping these extraordinary nine months of pregnancy be the positive experience it should be, rather than the endurance test it becomes for many.It's no supermodelBMW has just announced that its new model will talk to us. That's the last thing I want. Instead of wasting time and money on computer-generated conversation, why don't modern car manufacturers design something with the charm and sleek curves of vintage Mercedes, Saabs or Citroens. Supermodels all of them. I defy anybody to feel the same way about their Toyota Prius or family Suburu.Gaga's star turn          The remake of A Star Is Born – starring Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga – is total heaven. A triple-A love story that manages to be schmaltzy, indulgent and irresistible  The remake of A Star Is Born – starring Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga – is total heaven. A triple-A love story that manages to be schmaltzy, indulgent and irresistible – just a fraction too long. Cooper's swimming pool eyes alone would make it worth the ticket price but the standout is Lady Gaga's performance as the e-bar-singer-turned-a. For a rock star whose USP has been elaborate disguise, it's a fascinating surprise that she looks so utterly compelling stripped of her crazy carapace. From their first to their last meeting, it's completely believable that this couple have fallen madly in love since at the same time they are being swept off their feet, exactly the same thing is happening to us.Victory for mannersFor his new biography of Winston Churchill, Andrew Roberts had access to the papers of the great man's daughter Mary Soames. I wonder whether he discovered how she controlled her five noisy children, bellowing, bickering and name-calling around the dinner table? 'Is it kind? Is it true? Is it necessary?' she would admonish, adding if not, then they should shut up. I tried it once in my own home. Total silence.Putting on the styleThe sight of Lucia Hunt, above left, Susan Hammond, above right, and Laura Javid arriving at the Tory conference with their loose, tousled hair, flowing green midi-dresses and high-heeled pumps, confirmed a new style for spousal high command.When Samantha Cameron (a woman seemingly born glossy) arrived in Downing Street, bringing with her a wardrobe of skinny trousers, sleeveless shifts and figure-hugging block colour, she epitomised the same 21st Century power-dressing as Michelle Obama.The Blackpool wives have shifted the dial a notch to something more Everywoman than Alpha woman, but with a contemporary softness that is every bit as aspirational.

title: M5 9 quake shakes northern Haiti
story: An earthquake that struck off the northern coast of Haiti late on Saturday killed at least 11 people and injured more than a hundred when several buildings collapsed in the impoverished Caribbean country, officials saidThe police chief for the northwest region, Jackson Hilaire, said at least seven people were killed and more than 100 injured in Port-de-Paix.Another four people died in and around the town of Gros-Morne further south, including a boy struck by a falling building, said mayor Jean Renel Tide.'Everyone's pumped, from white men over 60 to white men over...The moment Brett Kavanaugh is finally sworn in as Supreme...Share this articleThe tremor was one of the strongest to hit Haiti since a 7.0 magnitude quake struck near the capital, Port-au-Prince, in 2010, killing tens of thousands of people.In a post on Twitter, President Jovenel Moise urged people to remain calm after the civil protection agency reported the latest quake had caused outbreaks of panic in northern towns.The agency said Port-de-Paix, Gros-Morne, the town of Chansolme and the island of Tortuga had suffered some of the worst damage. Some houses were destroyed, it said.          Haiti's Prime Minister called on his citizens to be cautious and calmLe Nouvelliste newspaper said one person was killed when an auditorium collapsed in Gros-Morne and that detainees were released from a police holding cell that was damaged.The tremor also damaged the facade of a church in the town of Plaisance and a house next door collapsed, the paper said.Saturday’s quake was felt in Port-au-Prince but initial reports on Twitter said it had not caused major damage there.Impoverished Haiti, where many live in tenuous circumstances, is especially vulnerable to earthquakes.

Owls are able to stand completely still to blend into branches and trees to fool possible prey          The clever birds also have the ability constrict and dilate their pupils at will - which explains the glazed glareThey can do them inidually as well, constricting one and dilating the other at the same time. It's possible that the animal was actually attempting to get a bit of rest.Owls are able to shut down one half of their brains while the other side is awake. This means they're able to keep their eyes open and let their minds rest.

title: Who Fernando Haddad Brazil president candidate revealed ahead election
story: Fernando was named as the official nominee of the Brazil Workers' Party on September 11, 2018Who is Fernando Haddad?Fernando Haddad is a Brazilian politician and academic who served as the Mayor of São Paulo from 2013 to 2017. He’s currently the Workers’ Party candidate for President of Brazil in the upcoming 2018 election.Haddad was born in São Paulo, Brazil on January 25, 1963.The son of Lebanese immigrants, he earned a master’s degree in economics and a doctorate in philosophy from the University of São Paulo before starting a career as an investment analyst at Unibanco.Haddad later worked as a consultant for the Institute of Economic Research Foundation before moving into public sector work, finding employment as the chief of staff to the Finance and Economic Development Secretary for São Paulo and eventually as a special advisor at the Brazilian Ministry of Planning, Budget and Management.Climbing the ranks of government steadily, he later was named as the Minister of Education for Brazil in July 2005. During his tenure, Haddad established the Basic Education Development Index to help better measure the quality of public primary and middle schools in Brazil.He also oversaw the implementation of a new scholarship program aimed at helping low-income students attend private colleges and made numerous reforms to the country’s National High School Exam.Haddad left his position in January 2012 and was named as the candidate for Mayor of São Paulo during the 2012 municipal elections in Brazil. After advancing to the second round of the election, he defeated the city’s former mayor, José Serra, with just over 55 per cent of the vote.After assuming his new duties as mayor in January 2013, he implemented a sweeping expansion of the city’s bike lane network but later sparked a major backlash in June of that year after announcing, along with the government of the state of São Paulo, that mass transit ticket prices would be increased.The decision ultimately led to mass protests in the São Paulo and many other major Brazilian cities.          Fernando Haddad served as the Mayor of São Paulo from January 2013 until January 2017By July 2016, Haddad was hobbled by a dismal approval ratings of only 14 per cent of city residents and lost his reelection bid in October 2016 to João Doria, the Brazilian Social Democracy party candidate.He ultimately left office in January 2017 after a four-year tenure as mayor of Brazil’s largest city.As the 2018 Brazil elections loomed, he was named as former President Lula da Silva’s running mate in August in his bid to regain the presidency.However, da Silva was later ruled as disqualified from running for president again by the Superior Electoral Court for violating the country’s Clean Record Act shortly afterwards on August 31 due to his conviction on corruption charges.Haddad was eventually named as da Silva’s replacement by the Workers’ Party on September 11 while Brazil Communist Party legislator Manuela d'Ávila took his place as the candidate for vice president. 2018 Brazil election polls   According a recent Americas SocietyCouncil of the Americas poll, Haddad is currently in second place ahead of the election, which will be held in stages from October 7 to October 28. Haddad leads a number of other candidates but still trails Bolsonaro, the conservative populist frontrunner of the Social Liberty Party who many have compared to U.S. President Donald Trump. Bolsonaro leads the poll with 35 percent of the vote while Haddad trails with 22 percent. Notably, Haddad's polling numbers have largely flatlined in recent days while Bolsonaro has surged ahead, making his victory, while not a sure thing, all the more likely as the election gets underway.Who is Sat Hari Khalsa? title: Britain goes boil Storm Leslie spark second SUMMER
story: Motorists ploughed through several inches of water after they crossed over Tower Bridge earlier today    This Vauxhall Corsa struggled over Tower Bridge in Central London as forecasters say there's more rain to come           Pedestrians sheltered under their umbrellas on Tower Bridge during this afternoon's brief shower which caused floodingSecond body found after family fishing tragedy as search...Car slides off road and rolls over into a ditch after...My lost son's spirit led me up Everest: The heartbreaking...Share this articleThursday and Friday feel more like a midsummer's afternoon, with highs in the mid-20s - around 5C higher than the average for this time of the year.However Britons will have to wait for the hot temperatures as rain is forecast across much of the South West of England, through into the Midlands and parts of the South East today.Wet weather is expected to push southeastwards today, helped along by a strong northeasterly winds that will lead to a notably colder day across much of England and Wales.          Damp Tottenham Hotspurs fans approached Wembley Stadium ahead of their Premier League clash with Cardiff City          St Paul's Cathedral stood out from the gloom as pedestrians crossed the River Thames over the Millennium Footbridge          Low cloud obscured this skyscraper as rain lashed the capital earlier today causing localised flooding           This woman was forced to break out a plastic rain covering to try and keep dry while walking across Tower BridgeHighs of 15C have been forecast in Dover, while Birmingham, Dumfries and Aberdeen will see lows of 7C. Sunshine and a few showers will wash over Scotland and Northern Ireland and will extend into northern England later.Heading into the evening, a cold and clear night is expected for most with widespread frost and isolated mist and fog patches. The northwest will be windier with some rain forecast.  Heavy rain and gales moving east across Scotland and Northern Ireland. Drier with sunny spells elsewhere, but remaining rather chilly for all. The weekend ahead is set to be a massive contrast between the North and South of the UK, as temperatures in the south plunge.          The projected track of Hurricane Leslie, which is currently battering the southern United States with 80mph winds, is shown          It is moving into the Atlantic and is not expected to travel towards Britain, but the tropical air will be picked up in jet streamsMet Office Forecaster Steven Keates said: 'All of us, particularly in the South, will feel the change, which will be a shock to the system.'The rain from the North of the UK will start pushing south east, with downpours reaching Wales by the morning, and East Anglia and South East England by lunchtime.'The heavy, persistent showers will make for a miserable weekend for southerners, as a strong North easterly wind combined with rain and a lack of sunshine will make it feel markedly cold.'Temperatures will struggle to reach 13C.'But he describes a much more pleasant picture up North, adding: 'Northern England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland will have a much brighter day, with sunny skies making for a nice but cold afternoon.'Temperatures will reach around 12C, and the lighter winds will make it a nice typical autumn day.'  The coming week will start off chilly on Monday, with temperatures ranging from 14C to 16C across the UK.           Visitors to Hyde Park in London were treated to this wonderful display of colour despite the constant drizzle          Luckily for these pedestrians, the showery weather is expected to be replaced by some autumnal sunshine early next week          Weather forecasters predict a high pressure front could be pushed over Britain bringing temperatures of up to 70CThere will be outbreaks of blustery rain in northern parts of the UK, particularly heavy and continuous in northwest Scotland. Winds will be strong, reaching gale force in coastal and uplands areas. Southern parts will be mainly dry with light patchy cloud and sunny spells. A mainly gentle breeze.Tomorrow night, strong winds and rain will continue in northern parts of the UK, though easing through the night in northern Scotland. Turning rather windy across central parts of the UK, with rain moving in to northern England and a spot of drizzle in Wales. A mainly dry night in the south with light cloud around.On Monday and Tuesday wet and windy weather will continue in the north tomorrow. Dry in north Scotland at first, but rain moving in later. Rather cloudy in southwest England and Wales, though mainly dry. Sunny spells in the east. Rain on Tuesday across Scotland and Northern Ireland. Mainly dry with sunshine elsewhere.

title: Forget handbags new fashion items luxury pull ups brands like Gucci
story: Dutch influencer Charlotte Groeneveld wore a pair of Chloe socks with matching heels during Paris Fashion Week last ThursdayDesigner socks are the must-have accessory this season - and fashionistas have even been spotted wearing them under their stilettos.The high fashion crowd isn't interested in a statement bag or impressive heels this Autumn, but a very pricey pair of socks.These designer accessories could cost as much as £855 for a single pair - with Gucci, Chloe, and Prada among the designers offering the luxury garment.Designer socks made an impression at New York Fashion Week, when model Natalie Suarez wore a pair of pink and green Gucci socks with sandals in the front row at a Michael Kors show.Then in Milan, mesh black socks made their way down the runway styled with dresses and stilettos in a Dolce &amp Gabbana show, the Times reported.But it's Chloe's £115 socks that are the most popular among Instagram influencers on the streets of Paris - and these aren't even the most expensive pair on the market. Gucci have a pair on sale for £855 - embellished with crystal beads in an interlocking G design.This is one of 14 designs the Italian brand has on offer, including a classic brown and tan pair covered with the GG design for £90.Alessandro Michele, the creative director for Gucci, has been credited for this high fashion makeover of socks.Share this articleHis models donned classic green and red striped pairs under open-toed shoes at the designer's 2016 show.And now, there are dozens of luxury pairs on the market for fashionistas to splash their cash on. title: Inside discounted 13 bed manor Poundland founder thats market
story: Founder of Poundland, Steve Smith, was been forced to slash £2.5million off the asking price of his six-bedroom mansion five months ago - and it still hasn't sold          The sprawling property, which overlooks the Severn Valley, is now on the market for  £3.95million, which is just a fraction of the Poundland founder's personal fortune          The father-of-three initially put the property up for sale in November 2014 using his own online estate agent for £6.5millionThe father-of-three said in May that he was expecting to lose money  in order to attract a quick buyer so he and 54-year-old wife Tracy can downsize.He said: 'We bought the house for £2.2million in 2002 but we spent probably around £4million doing it up so we are going to lose money.'We have had the house on the market for a while and had three people interested but their chains have broken down so we’ve put it on the market again.          Mr Smith said in May he had reduced the price in the hopes of attracting a quick sale so he and his wife could downsize their home          The property includes six reception rooms, such as this, and 13 bedrooms across multiple buildings on the extensive estate          There's plenty of room to entertain at the mansion, which includes this games room as well as its very own fully-stocked bar as well as a swimming pool          The huge properly is nestled on 28-acres of land, with two Gate House cottages and two gardens behind wrought iron gates'Since the kids have grown up and moved out it’s just me and the wife and it’s a big place for both of us to live in.'The property has reportedly had lots of interest but only three serious buyers have been involved so-far.'The urge to destroy is also a creative urge': Banksy...Forget handbags... the new must-have fashion items are...Villagers are ordered to remove stone planter to mark...Share this articleMr Smith initially hoped to avoid paying commission and save around £117,000 in solicitors’ fees by putting it on the market at EstatesDirect.com.The seven-bathroom property, which also has six reception rooms, is now listed on estate agent Knight Frank's website.           There's also an impressive swimming pool, a green house, and a lengthy drive which terminates with a turning circle and fountain           The spacious kitchen which includes a white wood central preparation island, an old-style Aga, and large formal dining area          There's even a dedicated bar and entertainment room where a potential owner could host their friends and family for events          One of 13 bedrooms in Hammer Hill House, which also includes a series of paddocks and woodlands over 28-acre groundsHammer Hill House includes a series paddocks and woodlands nestled on 28-acres of grounds in the Severn Valley. The property is positioned behind wrought iron electric gates and includes two Gate Lodge cottages - both with three bedrooms. It also boasts an extensive garage, office block, a green house and a swimming pool.Mr Smith set up Poundland with just one shop in Burton-upon-Trent, Staffordshire, when he was aged 27 in 1990. He sold his share of the business for £50million in 2002 and his Poundland stores now boast 500 across the UK.

title: Donald Tusk claims Brexit deal finalised 2019
story: European Council President Donald Tusk, pictured, has indicated he believes a deal on Britain's exit from the European Union could be completed before the end of the year          PM Theresa May will be given an opportunity to address EU leaders in Brussels during a crunch summit in Brussels on October 17-18This follows encouraging words from Commission President Jean-Claude Junker, who also indicated a deal was possible.With less than two weeks to go before a crunch summit in Brussels billed by the EU as the 'moment of truth' for Brexit negotiations, Juncker gave an upbeat assessment of the chances of a deal.Detectives probing death of gangster John 'Goldfinger'...PM launches Labour charm offensive to secure support for her...Share this articleThe change in tone comes two days after EU Council President Donald Tusk gave London a stern warning that time was running out to strike a deal in time for Britain's departure from the bloc at the end of March.Deadlines in EU talks are notoriously elastic, and Juncker told Austrian media that if an agreement was not reached at the October 17 and 18 summit, he was confident it could be done in November.  If Mrs May secures a deal in Brussels she will have to sell it to her party, some of whom are vehemently opposed to any proposal which will see Britain remain in the customs union'I have reason to believe that the potential for rapprochement between the two sides has increased in recent days,' Juncker said in comments reported by the Standard newspaper.'But it is not possible to predict whether we will be able to conclude the talks in October. If not, we will do so in November.'May has been invited to address the other 27 EU leaders over dinner on October 17, to give her a chance to convince her peers that a solution can be found to the sticking points in Britain's tortuous negotiations to leave the bloc.Diplomats have suggested the leaders could talk through the night and approve the outlines of an agreement while they are still in Brussels for the broader October 18 talks.At their annual conference this week, May urged her Conservative party - which is bitterly ided between Brexit hardliners and moderates - to unite behind her negotiating stance during what she warned would be the 'toughest phase' of talks.Juncker said the EU was determined to reach an agreement to avoid a 'no deal' Brexit, which experts say would cause chaos for both sides.'I believe that we must distance ourselves from this no deal scenario.'We are not there yet. But our will to reach an understanding with the British government remains unbroken.'           Donald Tusk, right, has held meetings with Taoiseach Leo Varadkar, left, about the future of the Irish border, which is currently the main stumbling block to securing a Brexit deal

title: Noel Gallagher says hed reform Oasis lunatic Corbyn PM
story: Noel Gallagher was asked whether he would rather reform Oasis or for Jeremy Corbyn to become the next Prime MinisterJon Lanslan, the leader of Momentum, the far-left activist group which has thrown its support behind Corbyn to become Prime Minister, attacked Gallagher on social media.The 'Lifelong Labour Leftie', who was educated at the £21,000-a-year Highgate School, wrote on Twitter: 'Your working class hero days are over Noel. You’re just another Blur now.'He was not the only left-wing political figure to take aim at the Manchester singer.Socialite Annabelle Neilson, 49, feared she was 'cursed'...Britain’s Got Talent judge David Walliams could net huge...Share this articleFormer Labour MP George Galloway also blasted Gallagher on Twitter.He wrote: 'Noel Gallagher enjoyed everything the socialisation of services could provide - but now he’s a multimillionaire. title: Teenage tearaway landed City job knocking door UKs richest district
story: Reggie Nelson (pictured) now works an an analyst with Legal &amp General Investment ManagementAstonishingly, the plan worked and Mr Nelson, 22, is now a well-paid analyst with Legal &amp General Investment Management.Mr Nelson’s remarkable story began one Saturday when he was 18. He took the Tube to Kensington in West London, Britain’s richest district, and spent the day knocking on door after door.He told anyone who answered: ‘I just wanted to know what skills and qualities you had that allowed you to live in a wealthy area like this so I can extrapolate that and use it for myself.’Terrifying moment stranger tries to murder 91-year-old...What does your London borough say about YOU? Map of tasks...Unilever's big U-turn: Bosses fighting for their jobs after...Share this articleSome slammed the door in his face, others offered only platitudes. But then Mr Nelson called at the home of Quintin Price, a leading City financier, and his wife Elizabeth.They invited him for a chat and a cup of tea and Reggie poured out his story. The couple were so impressed with his determination to make something of his life against the odds that they promised to help.First Mr Price arranged work experience for Mr Nelson and became his mentor, helping him get through university and train with City firms. A proud Mr Price said: ‘Reggie is flourishing. He is a transparently lovely lad and there’s no reason why he cannot go all the way.’His wife added: ‘When he came to the door that day I was overwhelmed by his bravery – it took courage to do what he did – and by his desire to get on in life.          Reggie hopped on the underground and decided to travel to Kensington to deliver his pitch‘He was incredibly well mannered and so smiley. We’re thrilled he’s doing so well.’Mr Nelson, who is now mentoring other youngsters from disadvantaged backgrounds, was raised by his mother in Woolwich, East London. ‘I could easily have gone down the wrong path – and nearly did – but I had good people around me,’ he said. ‘Someone said I needed to think out of the box if I was to get on in life. So then they came up with the door-knocking idea. It took me a few weeks to summon up the courage to do it, though.‘When I finally did and got off the Tube at Kensington, I saw all these expensive cars – Aston Martins and Mercedes – lining the streets.‘Everywhere you looked just looked like money. I rehearsed this pitch ready for when the door opened. And it worked.‘Before I met Quintin I didn’t even consider university. Now I want to keep going and see where my determination takes me. Hopefully it will be me with one of those houses in Kensington.‘For anyone in a similar position to mine, I would say knock on the right doors – and work hard.’

title: Fit Queen Rolls Royce unveils 4x4
story: The British-built Rolls-Royce Cullinan is a diamond in the rough as Rolls-Royce’s first ever purpose-built sports utility vehicle. The first year’s production is already sold out well ahead of first deliveries early next yearIt’s an awesome if rather initially disconcerting experience – thanks partly to the massive amounts of automotive horsepower unleashed by this SUV for the super-rich.You can choose to have fun in the driving seat, or let your driver take the strain while you relax in the sumptuous rear.'The urge to destroy is also a creative urge': Banksy...'They touched us anywhere they wanted, running their hands...Deaf schoolboy, 10, is kicked and stamped on before gang of...Share this articleCullinan comes in two main styles. For those with families and friends who want to do some rugged and adventurous off-roading, there is the flexible five-seater in Country Casuals and mucky wellies mode.But for more sober state, royal, or official VIP occasions, with perhaps a dash of pomp and circumstance, Rolls-Royce has created a more ‘regal’ fixed four-seater featuring specially styled rear side windows from which chauffeured passenger can see out and, if required, be seen and give a discreet wave.The Cullinan comes in two main styles. For those  who want to do some rugged and adventurous off-roading, there is the flexible five-seater in Country Casuals and mucky wellies modeThese are big and bold vehicles. Yet interestingly both versions look more lithe and slippery when in motion.But does Cullinan live up to the billing of being ‘the Rolls-Royce of SUVs’?The moment I climbed into the vast cabin – with I admit a degree of trepidation – I felt strangely empowered. I was sitting very high, in a commanding position, looking down the bonnet at the Spirit of Ecstasy ‘Flying Lady’ mascot, and cocooned in a luxurious sanctuary of calm.Firing up the engine, I slotted the automatic gear stick into ‘D’ for drive and I was off. Acceleration from the mighty 6.75litre twin turbo V12 engine is awesome, but balanced.          For more exclusive occasions Rolls-Royce has created a more ‘regal’ fixed four-seater featuring specially styled rear side windows from which chauffeured passenger can see outIt develops a powerful 571PS horse-power (563bhp) - equivalent to a detachment of US Seventh Cavalry or raiding party of braves.Steering and handling is sharper and more precise than the more stately flagship Phantom limousine. It’s nimble and has a surprisingly tight turning circle.On twisting country roads it proved particularly adroit. At one stage I appeared to be out-pacing a BMW on tight turns. It’s quiet too thanks to extensive soundproofing. But it is very engaging and will deliver some satisfying roar from the acceleration when driven boldly. I was, after all, making a statement.          The car's steering and handling is sharper and more precise than the famous Rolls-Royce Phantom limousine. It’s nimble and has a surprisingly tight turning circle - and it seems to be particularly good when fighting twisting country roadsNor do you have to expend too much effort if you want to go off-road.A simple push on one button – which the super-luxury car firm dubs the ‘Everywhere’ off-road terrain button - will suffice to tighten up its sinews and brace its vast 6.75-litre twin turbo V12 engine ready for some off-piste rock’n’rollsing, whether on grass and gravel or snow and mud.The really jaw-dropping thing about the new Rolls-Royce Cullinan is its ability to climb steep mountain tracks with the agility of of a goat.Perched precariously on a near vertiginous narrow mountain track more than 6,400ft above sea-level, you frankly do not expect to be driving a marque more commonly associated with luxury limousines.          The SUV is quiet too thanks to extensive soundproofing - something that is sure to popular with families. However, petrol-heads need not worry as it is very engaging and will deliver a satisfying roar from the acceleration when driven boldlyBut here I was tearing up Snow King Mountain overlooking well-healed Jackson Hole in Wyoming as effortlessly as if I were motoring up the driveway of a stately home.It was faintly surreal – but it was true. With the stately Spirit of Ecstasy ‘Flying Lady’ to guide me I was biting hard into gravel and mud at an unfeasibly steep angle to propel me up the mountainside, and whizzing around the tightest of tree and rock-bordered hairpin bends forming part of a ski-slope in what is known as the ‘Forever West’ cowboy state.This was aided immensely by the Cullinan’s clever ‘four-wheel steering’ which allows the rear wheels to turn within limits independently of those in front.Getting down the mountain was just as easy with the hill descent control giving automatic breaking at whatever speed I set, typically within 3mph to around 7mph on a good run.The balance, poise and power was astonishing. This is a Rolls-Royce, for heaven’s sake - limbing up and down mountains off-road.That said, not even Rolls-Royce will suggest that in off-road capability it is anywhere near that of Land Rover or Range Rover whose independent wheel articulation allows it to tackle much more extreme situations like crawling over rocks. It is luxurious SUV whose capability is likely to surprise and delight, however. And a minor marvel for all that. Where will it all end?          Nor do you have to expend too much effort if you want to go off-road as you just have to push on one button – which the super-luxury car firm dubs the ‘Everywhere’ off-road terrain button - to brace its vast 6.75-litre twin turbo V12 engine ready for some off-roadingThe Cullinan has been created to be as fit for a Queen as an active family, it was inspired by Lawrence of Arabia’s Rolls-Royce adventures in the desert.And Rolls-Royce really is out to conquer the world with what it has called ‘an all-terrain high bodied car’, and nothing so vulgar as a ‘Chelsea Tractor’. Mayfair perhaps, at a push.Its blend of 21st century hi-tech and hand-craftsmanship is designed to ensure it lives up to the boast of being ‘effortless everywhere’ whether driven on or off road.It’s so polite it’ll even do a little curtsey – dropping the door level through its suspension- to make it easier for you and your passengers to get in and out.          Getting down the mountain was just as easy with the hill descent control giving automatic breaking at whatever speed I set, typically within 3mph to around 7mph on a good run. The balance, poise and power was astonishing considering it is still a Rolls-RoyceMost well-heeled customers are also expected to pay at least £500,000 - double the £250,000 base price - by the time they have added their own sumptuous bespoke touches and ‘must have’ extras, such as the pop-out ‘viewing suite’ of two seats and a table which emerges like a Bond gadget from beneath the rear boot to offer the ‘best seat in the house’ for watching equestrian events, school sports days or falconry.Not forgetting the champagne fridge with matching flutes, whisky decanter and crystal tumblers - if you're being chauffeured in the rear.Built at the firm’s boutique factory at Goodwood in Sussex, which now employs 1,800 male and female craftsmen, Cullinan is also the first Rolls-Royce to feature a rear tail-gate.                             Most well-heeled customers are also expected to pay at least £500,000 - double the £250,000 base price                        Bosses at BMW-owned Rolls-Royce say its new £250,000 4X4 is ‘the ultimate rough diamond’ - taking its name from the legendary 3,106 carat Cullinan diamond, unearthed in 1905 in South Africa as the largest and most flawless gem ever found, elements of which are in the Crown Jewels.Launched to capitalise on the booming market for luxury off-roaders and ‘tested to destruction’ during rigorous trials around the world.The prestigious British car-maker says that after much agonising it made the decision to build a 4X4 following demand from customers globally for ‘the Rolls-Royce of SUVs’.Which is why Rolls-Royce has chosen to hold its global driving launch in the challenging terrain of the American Wild West, which has featured in countless Hollywood, near the exclusive resort of Jackson Hole, Wyoming.It’s a second home to the world’s rich, famous, and powerful – from world-leaders and business titans to music megastars and Hollywood ‘royalty’. Its well-heeled residents and visitors make Teton County, in which it is located, the wealthiest corner per capita of the United States, It also hosts the annual gathering of Central Bankers at the Economic Policy Symposium.          The Cullinan has been created to be as fit for a Queen as an active family, it was inspired by Lawrence of Arabia’s Rolls-Royce adventures in the desertYou can almost imagine yourself part of that invisible ‘club’ of movers and shakers.Yet the Cullinan is also designed to be as user-friendly and ‘without compromise’ for families on the school run as for royalty and Heads of State at home or abroad, with a ‘magic carpet ride’ promised on and off the road.Embracing the Spirit of Monarchy as much as the Spirit of Ecstasy, Rolls-Royce chiefs privately hope the ‘regal’ Cullinan will tempt Her Majesty out of her much loved Land Rovers and Range Rovers, as well as her state Bentley, and into the stately Cullinan.Rolls-Royce also points out that its vehicles – a byword for luxury - are no strangers to rough terrain, and that its highly-engineered cars have been used off-road throughout the firm’s 114 year history by the British army, Indian maharajahs as well as in desert fighting campaigns by Lawrence of Arabia who enthused that ‘A Rolls in the desert is above rubies.’Even Russian revolutionary communist Vladimir Ilych Lenin, who fought to bring down world capitalism, couldn’t help but be seduced by one of its most potent symbols – enjoying among his collection a specially adapted half-track Silver Ghost with skis to cope with Siberian winters.          Its blend of 21st century hi-tech and hand-craftsmanship is designed to ensure it lives up to the boast of being ‘effortless everywhere’ whether driven on or off roadCullinan is making history as Rolls-Royce’s first ever purpose-built off-roader since aristocratic adventurer Charles Rolls and engineer Henry Royce met and joined forces at Manchester’s Midland Hotel in May 1904 to create the world’s finest motor cars. They were designed to attract those Royals and wealthy aristocrats with an adventurous side, who liked to combine luxury with a stout vehicle that was also ‘swift and dependable.’Cullinan uses the same flexible aluminium space-frame platform as the latest £350,000 eighth-generation Phantom limousine, it aims to eclipse rival off-roaders such as Bentley’s Bentayga and Range Rover.The Cullinan also has an eight speed automatic gearbox.  It has four ‘coach’ doors – where the rear two open outwards from hinges at the back – plus Rolls-Royce’s first ever tail-gate at the rear.Riding on vast 22 inch wheels, there are two main styles.          The stunning Cullinan uses the same flexible aluminium space-frame platform as the latest £350,000 eighth-generation Phantom limousine, and it aims to eclipse rival off-roaders such as Bentley’s Bentayga and Range RoverFor adventurous families enjoying an off-road trek or a school-run journey, the flexible Cullinan in a choice of bold colours such as ‘Magma Red’ has five ‘lounge’ seats including the firm’s first ever three rear flexible seats which, when folded down, more than treble the 600 litres of boot space to up to 1930 litres.But for VIPs, captains of industry and even monarchs on the move, Rolls-Royce has created the more stately and sober fixed four seater in a shade such as ‘Tungsten Grey’ .Two inidual ‘pavilion’ seats are designed for privileged rear passengers who sit higher for ‘grandstand’ views from private jet-like side windows, allowing them to wave to the crowd if the mood takes, or sit back and enjoy their privacy when required. The two executive airline-style rear seats can be configured for ultimate comfort and are separated by a fixed centre console incorporating a drinks cabinet, Rolls-Royce whisky glasses and decanter, champagne flutes and a cool box to chill your bottles.To make entry and exit easier, Cullinan lowers itself 40mm (one and a half inches) when the driver clicks the unlock button or touches the door handle sensor for ‘keyless entry’, rising back up when the vehicle’s ‘Start’ button is pressed.The rear seats are even angled to allow occupants to talk to one another without straining their necks.    Bosses at BMW-owned Rolls-Royce say its new £250,000 4X4 is ‘the ultimate rough diamond’ - taking its name from the legendary 3,106 carat Cullinan diamond, unearthed in 1905 in South AfricaThere are plenty of luxuriously practical touches. To protect skirts and trouser legs from getting dirty when getting in and out of the Cullinan, the front and rear coach doors wrap low under the sill to ensure all dirt remains on the outside of the door, not on the inner sill itself.A glass partition creates a sealed cabin sanctuary and eco-system - by separating passengers from the rear hatch-back boot. This helps optimise temperature and reduce noise.Deploying rear picnic table reveals touch screens for sat-nav and other functions.Also on offer are a variety of ‘recreation modules’ – specially created units with a motorised drawer - that slot into the boot and contain bespoke equipment hampers from fly-fishing, shooting, rock-climbing and snow-boarding to drone-racing and photography. The open rear hatchback will shield you from rain.          With the new and unique SUV, Rolls-Royce chiefs privately hope the ‘regal’ Cullinan will tempt Her Majesty out of her much loved Land Rovers and Range Rovers, as well as her state Bentley Despite stretching to some 17ft 6 inches in length, being six ft high, and weighing more than 2.6 tons, its powerful 6.75 litre twin-turbo V12 engine developing 563bhp – equivalent to around six Ford Fiestas – can still propel it from rest to 60mph in five seconds (0 to 62mph-100kmhr in 5.2 seconds) with top speed electronically limited to 155mph. And it still has a relatively nimble turning circle of 13.23m.It certainly delivers on its promise of the traditionally smooth Rolls-Royce ‘Magic Carpet Ride’ on and off the road thanks to its sophisticated self-levelling air suspension designed to make it ‘effortless anywhere.’But it’s a real gas-guzzler with fuel consumption a mere 18.8mpg and hefty CO2 emissions of 341gkm.It has been designed to cope with terrain as erse on the road as country lanes, city streets, motorways and major highways, and off-road from desert sands, deep snow and ice, rough track, gravel, and wet grass.          Rolls-Royce also points out that its vehicles – a byword for luxury - are no strangers to rough terrain, and that its highly-engineered cars have been used off-road throughout the firm’s 114 year history by the British army, Indian maharajahs as well as in desert fighting campaignsPre-launch, Rolls-Royce said their camouflaged Cullinan prototypes were ‘tested to destruction all over the planet’ from the desert sand dunes of Africa and the Middle East, the canyons and the mountains of North America through which I have been driving, to the frozen snow and ice of the Arctic Circle, and the rugged glens of Highlands of Scotland.To ford streams it even has a wading depth of 21.2 inches (540mm  1ft 9 inches) though this is less than the 900mm boasted by the Land Rover Discovery.Yet at the heart of this rufty-tufty luxury off-roader is a woman’s touch. For Cullinan’s chief project engineer Caroline Krismer has spent the last five years of her life with her team perfecting Cullinan, the sixth car she has been put in charge of building, but the first Rolls-Royce. The executive who studied mechanical engineering in Graz, Austria told me: ‘It’s been my passion. I love cars and I love sporty luxury cars. Now it’s here, I have to pinch myself.’The high driving position and the plethora of safety feature will appeal to women as well as men, she says, and to families: ‘It’s a car you can drive daily. It’s effortless but with off-road ability.          For VIPs, captains of industry and even monarchs on the move, Rolls-Royce has created the more stately and sober fixed four seater in a shade such as ‘Tungsten Grey’ . Two inidual ‘pavilion’ seats are designed for privileged rear passengers who sit higher for ‘grandstand’ views from ‘private jet-like side window‘You feel safe in the car when you drive on your own, on the High Street or on the school run.'It’s engaging. You don’t have to have that much technical skill to drive it. It’s effortless. You can have your children in the back knowing they are safe and secure.’She said it was also ‘regal’, ‘elegant’ and perfectly suited to a monarch such as  the Queen.‘It’s a very relaxed position sitting in the back. There’s lots of leg room. ‘The vehicle also lowers itself about an inch and a half to make getting in and out easier: ‘If someone opens the door you can step pit over very high kerbs.’                             She said it was also ‘regal’, ‘elegant’ and perfectly suited to a monarch such as the Queen                        She noted: 'We began with a simple principle – to bring the famed Rolls-Royce ‘Magic Carpet Ride’ to all other terrains possible, while ensuring class-leading on-road behaviour in the SUV sector.’Intriguingly, and one senses frustratingly (though they would never say so publicly) for the British company whose name is a byword for near perfection, Rolls-Royce does not currently hold a Royal Warrant. That went to Bentley when the two firms – once united – were split when BMW bought Rolls-Royce Motor Cars and Volkswagen Group bought Bentley, along with its factory in Crewe.BMW then built a brand new boutique factory at Goodwood in Sussex where it hand-built and launched the seventh-generation Phantom in 2003.Once inside Cullinan, the driver is subsumed in hand-crafted luxury, including a cockpit-style dashboard with digital dials and a smaller, thicker steering wheel. The upper fascia clad in durable and water resistant ‘Box grain’ leather similar to that used in high-end Italian luggage and handbags. The entire dashboard is protected by ‘masculine’ leather pads, the top one fashioned like a wing. Leather on the back of the bespoke key matches that of interior.
